title_narrative: Mine action intervention in the Srebrenica region 2016-2017
description_narrative: Support ICMP and MPI activities in finding remaining missing persons from Srebrenica through mine clearance of ICMP and MPI locations of interest. 2. Create conditions for economic activities in Srebrenica region that will facilitate sustainable return through releasing of mine contaminated land and other mine action interventions. It will enable safe environment for population, facilitating reconstruction and productive use of agricultural land and forestry.

result_indicator_period_actual_comment_n: During April -June 2017, NPA completed demining on locations: Zagoni Kokarda 2, Zagoni-Kaolin, Klanac, Strana, Trnova kosa and Crni Vrh – Marš mira on a total of 124,618 m2. In June 2017 NPA started mine clearance on the locations: Zagoni Ladja 2 and Baljkovica Gavrići 3. During operations 4 x anti-personnel mines and 7 x ERW were located and destroyed.In the community of Zagoni-Blječeva 46 people (26 female, 20 male) working and living close to the areas of NPA operations were educated about mine hazards.In the community of Zaseok-Šetići 52 adults (28 female and 24 male) and 18 children in the primary school close to the areas of NPA operations were educated about mine hazards.

At 24th November 2016 NPA has started the integrated community mine action intervention in the community of Zaseok-Zvornik, including land release of mine contaminated areas through technical survey and mine clearance operations, mine risk education and community liaison activities. NPA teams released a total of 2,597 m2 in the community of Zaseok, but task is still in progress. 0.66% of the total area of planned 392459 m2 has been released so far during reporting period

The tasks with an area size of 65293 m2 was completed successfully according to the plan. Task Ravni Buljin- Jaglici, searching missing persons started 03.10.2016. finished 23.11.2016. Task Trasa Marsa mira Ravni Buljin- K. Brdo 1. dio started 11.10.2017. finished 06.11.2017. During operations 1 x anti-personnel mines and 5 x ERW were located and destroyed.

In the period October 2016 - November 2017 NPA successfully implemented the Project “Mine Action Intervention in the Srebrenica Region” supported by the Netherland Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Through fourteen months of Project implementation, NPA achieved all project’s objectives. Integrated community mine action intervention was conducted in four mine affected communities in the Srebrenica region based on priorities defined by local authorities. A total of 394,492 m2 of mine contaminated areas are released areas by NPA demining teams, which is 100,5% realization of the project’s plan. Released areas are handed over to the local communities for safe use. Mine action intervention created safe conditions for local population, enabled safe use of agricultural land and forest as main income for local population, enabled reconstruction of infrastructure and facilitated sustainable return. NPA team conducted mine risk education and community liaison for 810 people, including 773 adults (389 women and 384 men) and 37 children, aiming to reduce the vulnerability of the impacted population in mine affected community.

At 24th November 2016 NPA has started the integrated community mine action intervention in the community of Zaseok-Zvornik, including land release of mine contaminated areas through technical survey and mine clearance operations, mine risk education and community liaison activities. The task is completed on 24th March 2017. NPA teams released a total of 30,052 m2 in the community of Zaseok. In March 2017 NPA started mine clearance on the locations "Zagoni-Kaolin" and "Klanac", where a total of 43,619 m2 is cleared by the end of March 2017. 18.77% of the total area of planned 392459 m2 has been released so far.

During July -September 2017, NPA completed demining on locations: Zagoni Ladja 2, Baljkovica Gavrići 3, Baljkovica Rebići, Rebići Tijanići and LZ Pećišta Đogazi 2 on a total of 113,250 m2. In August 2017 NPA started mine clearance on the location: LZ Pećišta 1. During operations 14 x anti-personnel mines and 3 x ERW were located and destroyed. Mine risk education and community liaison activities have been conducting after completed mine clearance and technical survey activities in the community of Zaseok-Šetići. In the community of Zaseok-Šetići 277 adults (104 female and 173 male) and 19 children close to the areas of NPA operations were educated/informed about mine hazards, aiming to reduce vulnerability of impacted population in mine affected community and neighbouring communities. In the community of Baljkovica 225 adults (106 female and 119 male) living or passing by on daily basis close to the areas of NPA operations were educated/informed about mine hazards in order to reduce vulnerability of impacted population in mine affected community and neighbouring communities.
result_indicator_period_target_comment_n: Technical survey and clearance of contaminated area 65270 m2. Task Ravni Buljin- Jaglici, searching missing persons started 03.10.2016. finished 23.11.2016. Task Trasa Marsa mira Ravni Buljin- K. Brdo 1. dio started 11.10.2017. finished 06.11.2017.
NPA conducted demining operations at task/location Rebići Tijanići at the request of local authorities as a difference resurveyed areas.
